Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility findings and well-founded fear of persecution
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility finding due to inconsistencies in testimony
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) IRPA - Well-founded fear of persecution
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution based on personal circumstances
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: More than a mere possibility of persecution
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in visa details and recruitment claims
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Refugee hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Inconsistent statements about travel history and involvement
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Documentary evidence considered insufficient to overcome credibility issues
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Burden of proof on applicant to establish credible basis for fear
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board made patently unreasonable credibility findings
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Inconsistent statements and lack of sufficient evidence
Crimes.Relevant_Law: IRPA, Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Sufficiency of reasons provided by the Board
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose prior visa applications

Crimes.Crime_Name: Providing false or misleading information in a personal information form
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility due to material inconsistencies
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) IRPA - Basis for refugee protection
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Persecution fears related to family connections
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Subjective fear supported by objective evidence
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to disclose previous Canadian visas and false claims about deaths
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Refugee status determination and subsequent appeal
Crimes.Application_Error: False statements regarding personal history and associations
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None; Board relied on testimonial inconsistencies
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Applicant must demonstrate truthfulness and consistency
Crimes.Application_Factor: Central elements of claim undermined by contradictions
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Opportunity to respond to credibility concerns provided
Crimes.Document_Fraud: False information submitted in official forms
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Significant internal contradictions in core narrative
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Weight given to inconsistencies by decision maker

Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Adverse inference drawn from deliberate falsehood
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Residence history misrepresented during visa process
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Objective assessment of intent and materiality
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible explanation for false statement
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: No evidence ignored; focus on verifiable facts
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Misrepresentation requires false or misleading information that is material
Crimes.Application_Factor: No justification offered for the misrepresentation
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Applicant had opportunity to explain discrepancy
Crimes.Document_Fraud: False information provided directly to immigration official
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant failed to provide plausible justification
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Use of adverse inferences in credibility analysis
Crimes.Omission_Type: Affirmative false statement rather than omission
